isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 1000 MODELS - CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

note.para: For troubleshooting brake switch circuit input signals to the engine ECM, refer to the Engine Diagnostic Manual EGES-190 for T 444E or the Engine Diagnostic Manual EGES-240 for VT 365.

entry.para: Does hydraulic brake pump motor run when key is off and brake pedal is depressed and also when key is on and brake pedal is not depressed?
Does pump motor run with key on and brake pedal not depressed?
Disconnect diode assembly (48) from connector (47), then go to Step 22.
Does pump motor run with key off and brake pedal depressed?
Disconnect diode assembly (48) from connector (47), then go to Step 24.
Do the brake warning light and alarm work properly?
Disconnect brake monitor module connector (49) and measure resistance from circuit 90M to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90M, dash connector (2), or circuit 90M, then repair.
At (49) circuit 90-G, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90-G/ 11-G, then repair.
At (49) circuit 90E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90E, then repair.
At (49) circuit 90F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90F, then repair.
At (49) circuit 90P, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90P, then repair.
At (49) circuit 90T, measure voltage to ground.
Check bulb, alarm, and circuit 90T, then replace or repair problem.
At (49) circuit 90R and with brake pedal depressed, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90R/70B, then repair. If condition persists, refer to Section 5, Light Systems.
Reconnect connector (49) and move key switch to ignition position. Do alarm and brake warning light operate?
Brake warning system circuits check good.
Replace brake monitor module. If condition persists, refer to CTS-5280, Hydro-Max II Brake Monitor System.
Remove hydraulic brake relay from socket (300). At circuit 90A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90-FL/ 90/90A, then repair.
At socket (300) circuit 90H, measure voltage to ground. Turn key off and with brake pedal depressed, measure voltage from circuit 90H to ground.
Reconnect (300) and disconnect diode assembly (48) from connector (47). Go to Step 29.
At (300) circuit 90J, measure resistance to ground.
Disconnect circuit 90N from reserve pump motor. Install a jumper wire at relay socket (300) from circuit 90A to 90N. At reserve pump, measure voltage from circuit 90N to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90N, then repair.
Touch circuit 90N to reserve pump motor terminal. Does motor run?
Disconnect flow switch connector (381) and measure resistance across switch.
At (381), measure resistance of circuit 90-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90-G/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect flow switch connector and disconnect differential pressure switch connector (301). At (301) circuit 90L, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90L/90R, then repair.
At relay socket (300) circuit 90J, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 90J/90K, then repair. Reconnect (300).
At (47) measure voltage from circuit 90U to ground.
Check for open fuse F9 and locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse. If fuse is OK, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90U, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, test diode assembly (48). Did diode assembly fail?
Locate open or poor conn. in circuit 90H or dash conn. (2), then repair. Reconnect diode assembly.
At (47) and with brake pedal depressed, measure voltage from circuit 90D to ground.
Remove fuse F21 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F21 circuit 90B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90B or dash conn. (2), then repair.
Re-install fuse F21 and disconnect brake switch connector (50). At (50) measure voltage from circuit 90C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90C, then repair.
Measure resistance across switch (50) while brake pedal is depressed.
Locate open in circuit 90D, then repair. Reconnect (50).
Will multi-meter in diode test mode, test diode assembly (48). Did diode assembly fail?
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90H or dash conn. (2), then repair. Reconnect diode assembly.
Does the water-in-fuel system operate properly?
Does the heated fuel filter work properly?
Remove ignition relay (R20). At relay socket, measure voltage from cavity 1B, circuit 14K to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 14K, then repair.
At (R20), measure voltage from cavity 3B circuit 13F to ground.
Check for open circuit breaker F16. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 13F or dash conn. (2), then repair.
At (R20), measure voltage from cavity 3B circuit 13F to cavity 1C circuit 11-GG.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GG/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Bench test ignition relay (R20) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Apply +12V to relay pin 86 and ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Reconnect relay (R20). Turn key on and at fuse F38 cavity 5A, measure voltage of circuit 19/92 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19/92, then repair.
Disconnect circuit 19A from fuel filter heater. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 19A to ground.
Check for open fuse F38. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19A, filter conn. (6708), or circuit 19D, then repair.
With the fuel heater cooled to below 45°F, measure voltage from circuit 19A to the heater power stud.
Fuel filter, 19A to heater power stud.
Heated fuel filter circuitry checks good.
Repair or replace heated fuel filter.
Disconnect water-in-fuel module (470). Turn key on and at connector, measure voltage from circuit 19K to ground.
Check for open circuit breaker F16. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19K/13E, then repair.
At WIF socket (470), Install jumper from circuit 19K to 19L and turn key on. Does warning light operate?
Disconnect cluster connector (28). Turn key on and at cavity 11 circuit 19L, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19L, then repair.
Replace lamp with a known good one. Reconnect (28) and turn key on. Does lamp operate?
At WIF module connector (470) move jumper across circuit 19K to 19C. At the fuel filter, disconnect circuit 19C from the water probe. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 19C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19C, dash conn. (2), circuit 19C, fuel filter conn. (6708) or circuit 19C with, then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect WIF module (470). At water probe conn., jumper circuit 19C to ground. Does light work?
Water probe conn., jumper 19C to gnd.
Remove water probe and install jumper from the probe to ground. Measure voltage from circuit 19C to water probe feed stud.
Water probe, 19C to probe feed stud.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. WIF system checks good.
Does the suspension air dump operate with the key off?
Disconnect air dump solenoid connector (475). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 61A to ground.
Check for open circuit breaker F15. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 61, low air alarm conn. (474) or circuit 61A, then repair.
At (475), measure resistance from circuit 61-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 61-G/ 11-GB, then repair.
At solenoid harness side of (475), measure resistance from cavity A to cavity B.
At solenoid harness side of (475), measure resistance from cavity A to solenoid feed terminal.
(475), cav. A to solenoid feed term.
Locate open or poor connection in solenoid harness feed circuit, then repair.
At solenoid harness side of (475), measure resistance from cavity B to solenoid ground terminal.
(475), cav. B to solenoid gnd. term.
Locate open or poor connection in solenoid harness ground circuit, then repair.
Does the suspension low air pressure warning light operate properly?
Disconnect air dump solenoid connector (475). At cavity B, measure resistance of circuit 61-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 61-G/ 11-GB, then repair.
At (475) cavity C, measure voltage from circuit 40 to ground.
Disconnect cluster connector (28). Measure resistance from pin 13 circuit 40A to (475) circuit 40.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 40A, alarm conn. (474) or circuit 40, then repair.
Check warning light bulb. Is bulb OK?
Reconnect (475). Turn key on and at low air pressure switch feed, measure voltage to ground.
Low air press. sw. feed to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in air pressure switch feed circuit, then repair.
At air pressure switch, measure resistance from ground terminal to ground.
Low air press. sw. gnd. term. to gnd.
Locate open or poor connection in suspension low air pressure switch ground circuit, then repair.
Does the low air pressure alarm operate properly?
Disconnect low air alarm (474). Turn key on and measure voltage from socket cavity 2 circuit 61/61A to cavity 5 circuit 40/40A.
Check for corrosion or poor connection in socket (474), then repair.
Will engine crank over when the transmission is in neutral and the key switch (63) is moved to the start position?
Refer to Engine Crank Inhibit System Circuit Test.
Remove ignition relay (R20). At relay socket, measure voltage from cavity 1B, circuit 14K to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 14K, then repair.
At (R20), measure voltage from cavity 3B circuit 13F to ground.
Check for open circuit breaker F16. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 13F or dash conn. (2), then repair.
At (R20), measure voltage from cavity 3B circuit 13F to cavity 1C circuit 11-GG.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GG/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Bench test ignition relay (R20) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Apply +12V to relay pin 86 and ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Reconnect relay (R20). Turn key on and at fuse F36 cavity 5A, measure voltage of circuits 13L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 13L, then repair.
Disconnect Allison (LCT) TCM Gray conn. (3031), pins 2 & 4, circuits 13K/102/104 to transmission. Turn key on and measure voltage from pins 2 & 4 to ground.
Check for open fuse F36. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 13K/102/104, or TCM conn. (3031), then repair.
Connect Allison (LCT) TCM Gray conn. (3031), and the transmission. circuits check good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for troubleshooting the ECM2.
